data.title: CV MARION
data.meta_description: CV MARION - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. M A R I O N C A T T I N I Personal email marion.cattini@tiscali.co.uk Personal statement I have strong experience of supporting at director level as a PA/Business Manager in a number of high profile companies. I have developed solid interpersonal skills through liaising with relevant stakeholders including the Royal family’s household and high ranking officials at Downing Street and have significant experience in communicating on behalf of directors to all levels of the business. My degree in Business Studies has further developed my analytical and logical approach to tasks which I have transferred to the workplace. Ability to work under pressure, strong organisational skills, and highly numerate. Results focused, hard working, meticulous and conscientious, with advanced IT skills in Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point, Internet and financial databases. Career summary 2013-present BARCLAYS BANK PLC, Personal Assistant  One to one role to MD (CIO Europe, Head of Technology Risk, Interim Chief of Staff, and Head of Transformation for Personal & Corporate Banking). As the MD holds four MD roles there is extensive and complex diary management (including arranging meetings, lunches, drinks/dinners, corporate events, restaurant reservations and booking meeting rooms) as well as multiple time zones. Use initiative to anticipate and resolve any conflicts, working with minimal guidance and supervision.  Oversee manager’s inbox which includes an average of 400 emails per day and action work in his absence where appropriate.  Booking and co-ordinating complex national and international travel arrangements, ensuring efficient use of time and minimal expenditure. Arranging visas to tight deadlines.  Attend internal meetings, take minutes and ensure actions are followed up accordingly.  Manage the numerous weekly/bi weekly/monthly team leadership meetings.  Dealing with personal and confidential matters.  Team working: including providing cover during sickness or holiday absence.  Where necessary, review and improve processes to ensure an optimal service is delivered, advocating best practice in all areas of the role. Utilise my internal networks to help solve problems and devise effective solutions.  Archiving and filing duties.  Other duties include shorthand dictation, preparing presentations, expenses (via SAP), using the HR system, acting as main reference point and gatekeeper, work to deadlines and prioritise work requests. Key achievements:  Continuing to maintain deadlines even while my managers’ role grew from two MD roles to four.  Due to proven ability given additional responsibilities ie to review and action Request, One Cert, Expenses, Travel requests, Team annual leave.

2. 2006-Dec 2012 AUDIT COMMISSION, Legal Personal Assistant & Business Manager  Managing team’s business planning, budgeting, invoicing, expenses and time recording.  Compile quality procedures policy, monthly performance indicator reporting using RAG status and monthly risk management returns for senior management.  Creating and maintaining team intranet site. Responsible for ensuring legal content including new/updated legislation and corporate governance is accurate and up to date.  Responsible for gathering, compiling and analysing information to disseminate to the Public Audit Forum for benchmarking in order to scale against external bodies and quantify value for money.  Assisting with the organisation’s governance framework by way of using the in-house template, formatting, proof reading and uploading onto the intranet.  Additional responsibility as Information Asset Manager to manage the team’s information assets in line with in-house security policies and legislation including providing security guidance to the team and resolving issues.  One to one PA role to Commission Solicitor, duties include diary management, shorthand dictation, minute taking, preparing presentations and acting as main reference point and gatekeeper. Managing the legal case management files for the legal team. Use of Meridio (file sharing software) and internal templates. Key achievements:  Managing the team budget of £800k pa which includes forecasting, ensuring within the confines of the budget, identifying saving opportunities and business planning. I created and implemented a method for financial inputting, saving the company time (312 hours pa) and money.  Selected to lead on the team’s office move due to my strong organisational and communication skills, and administered paper based system to a paperless case system. 2005-2006 PA temporary assignments: English Heritage Commission for Social Care Inspection Management Consultancies Association The Prince’s Foundation 1999-2005 BRITISH COUNCIL, Personal Assistant Extensive organisation of international travel, diary management including multiple time zones, use of shorthand, minute taking, preparing presentations, research, main reference point and gatekeeper. Key achievements: Assisting the Prime Minister’s Initiative to build a strategy and marketing plan to establish the UK as a world leader in global student recruitment. Liaising with Downing Street, Department for Education & Skills and University Vice Chancellors. I was the sole assistant to my director for management of the UK National Commission for UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific & Cultural Organisation) for 3 months until a team of 3 were appointed while continuing business as usual. 1997-1999 Newham Social Services, Personal Assistant 1992 Lloyd Park Playscheme, Treasurer & Fund Raiser (voluntary work) 1987-1989 KPMG, Personal Secretary 1982-1987 Central Electricity Generating Board, Private Secretary, Accounts Assistant
